UNDERSTAND I'LL STAY WITH YOU EVERY DAY.
<u>A</u>                              <u>E</u>
MAKE YOU LOVE ME MORE IN EVERY WAY.
               <u>A</u> <u>E</u>                   <u>A</u>   <u>E</u>
SO IF YOU WANT ME   JUST LIKE I NEED YOU.
                 <u>D</u>
YOU KNOW WHAT TO DO.
 
              
_______________________________________________________
Contribuição: João Paulo Dias(jotinhadias@bol.com.br)

title: You Can´t Do That

Released on March the 20th of 1964. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Tabbed by:PJVillanueva Chords: G7 353463 C7 x32310 D7/#9 x5456x D7 x5453x B 799877 Em x79987 Am x02210 Bm x24432 D xx0232 G7 I got something to say that might cause you pain If I catch you talking to that boy again C7 G7 I'm gonna let you down, and leave you flat D7/#9 C7 G7 D7 Because I told you before, oh you can't do that G7 Well it's the second time I caught you talking to him, Do I have to tell you one more time it's a sin C7 G7 I think I'll let you down, and leave you flat D7/#9 C7 G7 Because I told you before, oh, you can't do that B Em Am Bm G7 Everybody's gree--en, 'cause I'm the one who won your love, B Em Am Bm D But if they'd see---en, you talking that way, they'd laugh in my face G7 So please listen to me if you wanna stay mine, I cant help my feelings I go outta my mind C7 G7 I'm gonna let you down, and leave you flat D7/#9 C7 G7 D7 Because I told you before, oh you cant do that Solo: G7 C7 G7 D7/#9 C7 G7 B Em Am Bm G7 Everybody's gree--en, 'cause I'm the one who won your love, B Em Am Bm D But if they'd see---en, you talking that way, they'd laugh in my face G7 So please listen to me if you wanna stay mine, I cant help my feelings I go outta my mind C7 G7 I'm gonna let you down, and leave you flat D7/#9 C7 G7 A Because I told you before, oh you cant do that

title: Yesterday (Fingerpicking help)
raw_tab:
Yesterday.(Fingerpicking help)

raw_tab:

 Too much monkey business.  Too much monkey business.

 Too much monkey business.  Too much monkey business.

title: The Ballad of John And Yoko
raw_tab:
Transcribed by: Thiago Augusto de Souza Zanetti
Email: mrkite@globo.com

Antes de tudo, algumas notas: essa música dos Beatles foi gravada com apenas dois deles em estúdio 
(John Lennon e Paul McCartney), com Paul fazendo o baixo, bateria e backing vocal, e o John fazendo
as guitarras e o vocal principal. O Lick 1 sofre pequenas variações ao longo da música, e é fácil de 
perceber quando se ouve (mas é difícil de escrever). Eu escrevi a linha de baixo, porque é o instrumento 
mais marcante nessa música. Eu recomendo tocar essa música em 3 pessoas, para que uma faça o baixo, outra 
as bases e a outra faça os licks e riffs do refrão. Divirtam-se! :)

RIFFS E LICKS USADOS DURANTE A MÚSICA:
BAIXO:
Baixo 1:         Baixo 2:          Baixo 3:          Baixo 4:
-------------|  |--------------|  |--------------|  |----------------------------------------------------------|
-------------|  |--------------|  |--------------|  |----------------------------------------------------------|
-------------|  |--------------|  |----------1---|  |----------------------------------------------------------|
-------------|  |--------2-4-2-|  |-----1--4---4-|  |------4--4---------4--4--------2--2-----------------------|
-------2-4-2-|  |--0--4--------|  |--2-----------|  |--2------------2----------------------4---2-------2-------|
-0--4--------|  |--------------|  |--------------|  |------------2------------2--------------------4-------0---|

RIFFS DO REFRÃO:
Chorus 1:        Chorus 2:        Chorus 3:       Chorus 4:        Chorus 5:         Chorus 6:
--9--8--7--5-| |--4--3--2--0--| |-11--10--9--7-| |--0--2--3--4--| |-----4--------| |-4--3--2--2/4--|
-------------| |--------------| |--------------| |--------------| |--------------| |---------------|
--9--8--7--6-| |--4--3--2--1--| |-11--10--9--8-| |--1--2--3--4--| |-2/4---4--3-2-| |-4--3--2--2/4--|
-------------| |--------------| |--------------| |--------------| |--------------| |---------------|
-------------| |--------------| |--------------| |--------------| |--------------| |---------------|
-------------| |--------------| |--------------| |--------------| |--------------| |---------------|

LICKS:

Lick 1:                           Lick 2:   Lick 3:
-12----------------------------|  |-12/-|  |-------12-----------|
----12b14r12-12b14r12-12b14b12-|  |-12/-|  |-12b14----14r12-12v-|
-------------------------------|  |-----|  |--------------------|
-------------------------------|  |-----|  |--------------------|
-------------------------------|  |-----|  |--------------------|
-------------------------------|  |-----|  |--------------------|

Intro:
<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)

<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)                       (Lick 1)
Standing in the dock at Southampton,
                                      (Lick 1)
Trying to get to Holland or France. 
<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)
The man in the mac said, "You've got to turn back". 

You know they didn't even give us a chance. 



                         <u>A7</u> (com baixo 2) (Chorus 1)
Christ you know it ain't easy, 
                         <u>E</u> (com baixo 1) (Chorus 2)
You know how hard it can be.
                    <u>B7</u> (com baixo 3) (Chorus 3) 
The way things are going 
                         <u>E</u> (com baixo 1) (Chorus 2)
They're gonna crucify me.

<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)                     (Lick 1)   
Finally made the plane into Paris,
                               (Lick 1)
Honey mooning down by the Seine.
<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)
Peter Brown called to say, 

"You can make it O.K., 

You can get married in Gibraltar, near Spain". 


                         <u>A7</u> (com baixo 2) (Chorus 1)
Christ you know it ain't easy, 
                         <u>E</u> (com baixo 1) (Chorus 2)
You know how hard it can be. 
                    <u>B7</u> (com baixo 3) (Chorus 3) 
The way things are going 
                         <u>E</u> (com baixo 1) (Chorus 2)
They're gonna crucify me. 

<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)                          (Lick 1)
Drove from Paris to the Amsterdam Hilton,
                               (Lick 1)   
Talking in our beds for a week. 
<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)
The newspapers said, "Say what you doing in bed?" 

I said, "We're only trying to get us some peace". 


                         <u>A7</u> (com baixo 2) (Chorus 1)
Christ you know it ain't easy, 
                         <u>E</u> (com baixo 1) (Chorus 4)
You know how hard it can be. 
                    <u>B7</u> (com baixo 3) (Chorus 5) 
The way things are going 
                         <u>E</u> (com baixo 1) (Chorus 2)
They're gonna crucify me. 


<u>A7</u> (com baixo 2)
Saving up your money for a rainy day, 

Giving all your clothes to charity. 
<u>A7</u> (com baixo 2)
Last night the wife said, 

"Oh boy, when you're dead 
    <u>B7</u> (com baixo 3)
You don't take nothing with you 
                       (pausa)
But your soul - think!" 


<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)                (Lick 1)
Made a lightning trip to Vienna,    
                               (Lick 2)
eating chocolate cake in a bag. 
<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)                               (Lick 2)
The newspapers said, "She's gone to his head,

title: The Ballad of John And Yoko
raw_tab:
Transcribed by: Thiago Augusto de Souza Zanetti
Email: mrkite@globo.com

Antes de tudo, algumas notas: essa música dos Beatles foi gravada com apenas dois deles em estúdio 
(John Lennon e Paul McCartney), com Paul fazendo o baixo, bateria e backing vocal, e o John fazendo
as guitarras e o vocal principal. O Lick 1 sofre pequenas variações ao longo da música, e é fácil de 
perceber quando se ouve (mas é difícil de escrever). Eu escrevi a linha de baixo, porque é o instrumento 
mais marcante nessa música. Eu recomendo tocar essa música em 3 pessoas, para que uma faça o baixo, outra 
as bases e a outra faça os licks e riffs do refrão. Divirtam-se! :)

RIFFS E LICKS USADOS DURANTE A MÚSICA:
BAIXO:

-------2-4-2-|  |--0--4--------|  |--2-----------|  |--2------------2----------------------4---2-------2-------|

Standing in the dock at Southampton,
                                      (Lick 1)
Trying to get to Holland or France. 
<u>E</u> (com baixo 1)
The man in the mac said, "You've got to turn back". 

You know they didn't even give us a chance.

They're gonna crucify me.

Finally made the plane into Paris,
                               (Lick 1)
Honey mooning down by the Seine.

      <u>A7</u>               <u>G</u>        <u>B7</u>
too much you´re gonna shout a-loud
 <u>Em</u>                     <u>Em7</u>      <u>A7</u>          
You know that what you eat you are but what is 
<u>Em7</u>    <u>A7</u>        <u>G</u>   <u>B7</u>
sweet now turns so sour
 <u>Em</u>                 <u>Em7</u>        <u>A7</u>             <u>Em7</u>

   <u>A7</u>                   <u>G</u>    <u>B7</u>
too much you´re gonna shout a-loud

SOLO (baseado na melodia vocal da 1ªestrofe)
              <u>Em</u>               <u>C</u>         <u>Em6</u>  
 Yes you´ll have to have them all pull out after 
    <u>C</u>        <u>C7M</u>    <u>G</u>
the Savoy Truffle
----------------------------------------------------
 Se vc reparar na letra , ela fala sobre marcas de doces famosos 
daquela época. Diz a lenda q George fez essa música para seu amigo 
Eric Clapton que comia muitos doces e tinha problemas dentários.
 O solo do final eu ainda não tirei e por isso não pus . Ele começa 
 bem agudo e alto (para "puxar"
a frase "shout a-loud")e vai se caminhando em cima da linha vocal 
das duas primeiras estrofes.
 Além disso , alguns acordes podem ser adaptados e trocados por 
outros parecidos com o mesmo efeito (como o <u>Em6</u> e o <u>C7M</u>) já q essa é
 uma         versão 'simplificada' da música, para se tocar no 
violão ou fazer a base na guitarra, e podem haver variações.


_______________________________________________________
Contribuição: Francisco Pires de Camargo(chicopires@yahoo.com)

                   <u>C</u>                <u>C/B</u>

 <u>Am7</u>                   <u>D7</u> 
Rocky Raccoon checked into his room 
Only to find Gideon's bible 
Rocky had come equipped with a gun 
To shoot off the legs of his rival 
His rival it seems had broken his dreams 
By stealing the girl of his fancy 
Her name was Magil and she called herself Lil 
But everyone knew her as Nancy 
Now she and her man who called himself Dan 
Were in the next room at the hoe down 
Rocky burst in and grinning a grin 
He said "Danny boy this is a showdown" 
But Daniel was hot- he drew first and shot 
And Rocky collapsed in the corner 
   
Now the doctor came in stinking of gin 
And proceeded to lie on the table 
He said "Rocky you met your match" 
And Rocky said, "Doc it's only a scratch 
And I'll be better, I'll be better doc as soon as I am able" 
Now Rocky Raccoon he fell back in his room  
Only to find Gideon's bible 
Gideon checked out and he left it no doubt 
To help with good Rocky's revival 
 
 
 
<u>Am7</u>  x 0 2 0 1 3

title: One and One is Two
raw_tab:
Essa música foi composta por Paul McCartney, oficialmente com 
créditos (Lennon/McCartney), em 1964.
Os Beatles nunca lançaram essa música em algum álbum oficial, pois
ela foi doada ao grupo "Billy J. Kramer and The Dakotas".
No entanto, há uma versão demo dessa música, com Paul treinando,
só disponível em discos piratas de gravações raras.

title: Obladi Oblada
raw_tab: These are the chords from the actual white album music book. Those other books tell you the fake chords. Intro: F Bb Bb F F7 Bb Verses: 1. Desmond has a barrow in the market place Molly is the singer in a band. 2. Desmond takes a trolley to the jewlers store buys a 20 karat golden ring. Eb Bb F Bb Desmond says to Molly "Girl I like your face" and Molly says this as she takes him by the hand. Takes it back to Molly waiting at the door and as he gives it to her she begins to sing. (After Each Verse Play Chorus) Bb Dm/F Gm Bb F Bb Chorus: Obladi Oblada life goes on bra lala how their life goes on. Eb Bb Bridge: In a couple of years they have built a home sweet home. Eb Bb F With a couple of kids running in the yard of Desmond and Molly Jones. (Other 2 Verses have same chords as first two) Ending: Gm F Bb And if you want some fun take obladi-blada (Paul: Thank You.)

                Mother Nature´s Son.
        
 ----------------------------------------------------
 A música é basicamente isso . O solo é a linha melódica do vocal 
solada no violão de aço. Faça cada um do teu jeito. Os acordes que 
poderiam dar problema são o <u>F/D</u> e o <u>G/D</u>. Para fazê-los basta deixar 
o acorde de <u>D</u> montado e deslocar para a quinta e sétima casa 
respectivamente. Qualquer dúvida ou opinião , mandem um e-mail para 
mim. Abraço

_______________________________________________________
Contribuição: Francisco Pires de Camargo(chicopires@yahoo.com)

title: Maxwell's Silver Hammer
raw_tab:
<u>D</u>                   <u>B7</u>                   <u>Em</u>
Joan was quizzical, studied pataphysical science in the home,
<u>A7</u>                                     <u>D</u>           <u>A</u>
late night all alone with a test tube, oh, oh, oh, oh.
<u>D</u>               <u>B7</u>                    <u>Em</u>    
Maxwell Edison, majoring in medicine, calls her on the phone.
<u>A7</u>                                  <u>D</u>       <u>A</u>
Can I take you out to the pictures, Jo-o-o-oan?
     <u>E7</u>                              <u>A7</u> 
But, as she's getting ready to go, a knock comes from the door:

<u>D</u>                                        <u>E7</u>
Bang! Bang! Maxwell's silver hammer came down upon her head.
<u>A7</u>                                         <u>Em</u>        <u>A7</u>      <u>D</u>
Clang! Clang! Maxwell's silver hammer made sure that she was dead.


Back in school again, Maxwell plays the fool again, teacher gets annoyed.
Wishing to avoid an unpleasant sce-e-e-ene.
She tells Max to stay when the class has gone away,
so he waits behind. Writing fifty times "I must not be so-o-o-o.
But, when she turns her back on the boy, he creeps up from behind:

{Chorus}

P.C. thirtyone said "We've caught a dirty one.", Maxwell stands alone.
Painting testimonial pictures, oh, oh, oh, oh.
Rose and Valerie, screaming from the gallery, say he must go free.
The judge does not agree. And he tells them so-o-o-o.
But, as the words are leaving his lips, a noise came from behind:

{Chorus}

title: Lovely Rita
raw_tab:
T3 = Low Tom
T2 = Medium Tom
T1 = High Tom
SD = Snare Drum
HH = Hi-Hat
BD = Bass Drum
o  = Open Hi-Hat
>  = Accent (Play louder than usual)

This is a neat little intro for "Lovely Rita" courtesy of
Ringo.  It appears in the same form right before the piano
solo.

T3  ---- ---- ---- 4n4n
T2  ---- nnn2 n3nn ----
T1  nn1n n2nn ---- ----
SD  1nnn 2nnn ---- ----

Here's the rest of the song.

         >         >         >         > >
                                         o
HH  1n1n 2n2n 3n3n 4n4n 1n1n 2n2n 3n3n 4n4n
SD  ---- 2nnn ---- 4nnn ---- 2nnn ---- 4nnn
BD  1nnn ---- 3n3n ---- 1nnn ---- 3n3n ----

raw_tab:
Essa é uma musica bem facil.É a versão do album D We've been friends for, oh, so long G I let you share what's mine Em When you mess with the girl I love D It's time to draw the line G Em Keep your hands (Keep your hands) off my baby C Ain't a-gonna tell you, but a one more time G Em So keep your hands(Keep your hands) off my baby C Boy, you get it through your head D That girl is mine A I don't mind if you lend my clothes G But you will be indebted Em Here is something that you get straight D There's one thing you don't touch G Em Keep your hands (Keep your hands) off my baby C Ain't a-gonna tell you, but a one more time G Em So keep your hands(Keep your hands) off my baby C Boy, you get it through your head D That girl is mine Baby G Em Keep your hands (Keep your hands)off my baby C Ain't a-gonna tell you, but a one more time G Em So keep your hands (Keep your hands)off my baby C Can't you get it through your head? D That girl is mine

Am7-D7 Am7-D7 I'm a loser, I'm a loser, Am7 F D7 And I'm not what I appear to be. G D F G Of all the love I have won or have lost D F G There is one love I should never have crossed. D F G She was a girl in a million my friend, D F G I should have known she would win in the end.
Am7-D7 Am7 D7 I'm a loser, and I lost someone who's near to me. G Em Am7 F D7 I'm a loser, and I'm not what I appear to be.
G D F G Although I laugh and I act like a clown D F G Beneath this mask I am wearing a frown. D F G My tears are falling like rain from the sky. D F G Is it for her or myself that I cry. Chorus Instrumental: G D F G G D F G Am7-D7 Am7-D7 G Em Am7 F D7 G D F G What have I done to deserve such a fate? D F G I realize I have left it too late. D F G And so it's true pride comes before a fall D F G I'm telling you so that you won't lose all. Chorus Instrumental

raw_tab:

         <u>F</u>                  <u>C</u>           <u>C7</u> <u>Csus7</u>           <u>F</u>

3. Hey Jude, don't let me down, you have found her, now go and get her,

title: Here There And Everywhere

title: Her Majesty
raw_tab:
From: Glen Norman Pavan 

  
title:  
album:  Abbey Road 
tuning:  standard


her majesty's a pretty nice girl but she doesn't have a lot to say
her majesty's a pretty nice girl but she changes from day to day
I wanna tell her that I love her a lot but I got to get a belly full of wine
her majesty's a pretty nice girl someday I'm gonna make her mine ooh yeah
someday I'm gonna make her mine

possible version three:   upper fretboard tapping   
     
I know jack shit about tapping...
I've seen one friend do it and it blew my mind;  this is NOT the kind 
where you tap with the right hand high on the fretboard and the left hand 
low on the fretboard doing a counter line.  Stu Hamm I'm not, nor aspire 
to be.   This is for fun.  And it helps if you keep your left index 
finger across the 12th fret of both D and G strings to retain clarity and 
harmonics

L=left hand    R=right hand

   L     R  R  R  L  L  L R     L R  R     R   R  R  L L  R

title: Helter Skelter
raw_tab: Intro: G When I get to the bottom I go back to the top of the A slide, where I stop and I turn and I go for a E G ride, till I get to the bottom and I see you again. E Yeah yeah yeah! Verse: E Well do you don't you want me to make you I'm coming down fast but don't let me break you G Tell me tell me tell me come on tell me the answer A E Well you may be a lover but you ain't no dancer. Chorus: A Well, Helter Skelter E Helter skelter A E Helter skelter Yeah So much for verses and Choruses. The rest are pretty much the same, except that the rest of the verses hit the G chord a little sooner (at the beginning of the third line of the verse). Here's the instrumental in the middle: E A E A E 'Cos here she comes

I don't really know D7 G7 No matter how I try, I just can't make her cry F G7 'Cause she'll never break, never break Am Never break, never break this heart of stone C Oh, no, no, no, this heart of stone G7 C F Don't keep on looking that same old way D7 G7 If you try acting sad, you'll only make me glad Am Better listen little girl, you go on walkin g down the street Am7 I ain't got no love, I ain't the kind to meet F G7 'Cause you'll never break, never break Am Never break, never break, this heart of stone C Oh, no, no, you'll never break this heart of stone darlin' F G7 No, no, this heart of stone you'll never break it darlin' Am You won't break this heart of stone C Oh, no, no, no, you better go, you better go home F G7 C 'Cause you'll, you'll never break this heart of stone, you better, you better

raw_tab: Introdução: Bm E G#m G#m7 G#m You move it to the left and you go for yourself G#m7 You move it to the right if it takes all night Am Now take it kinda slow with a whole lotta soul G#m Don´t move it too fast, just make it last G#m7 You scratch just like a monkey G#m Yeah ya do real cool, you slide it to the limbo G#m7 How low can you go Am Now come on, baby, don´t fall down on me now G#m Just move it right here to the Harlem Shuffle G#m7 Yeah, yeah, yeah, do the Harlem Shuffle Am Hitch, hichhike, baby, across the floor Bb I can´t stand it no more, now come on baby Am Now get into your slide, just ride, ride, lil´ pony ride Am7 Yeah, yeah, yeah, do the Harlem Shuffle Am Yeah, yeah, yeah, do the Harlem Shuffle Am7 Do the Monkey Shine Am Yeah, yeah, yeah, shake a tail feather, baby Am7 Yeah, yeah, yeah, do the Harlem Shuffle

title: For No One
raw_tab:
<u>C</u>               <u>Em/B</u> 
Your day breaks, your mind aches 
 <u>Am</u>            <u>C/G</u>              <u>Fmaj7</u>               <u>Bb</u> 
You find that all her words of kindness linger on 
               <u>C</u>  
When she no longer needs you 

  <u>C</u>               <u>Em/B</u> 
She wakes up, she makes up 
 <u>Am</u>            <u>C/G</u>              <u>Fmaj7</u>               <u>Bb</u> 
She takes her time and doesn't feel she has to hurry 
               <u>C</u> 
She no longer needs you 

Chorus: 
            <u>Dm</u>             <u>A7</u> 
And in her eyes you see nothing 
 <u>Dm</u>                   <u>A7</u>     <u>Dm</u> 
No sign of love behind the tears 
            <u>A7</u> 
Cried for no one 
 <u>Dm</u>                       <u>A7</u>     <u>Dm</u>   <u>G11</u> <u>G7</u> 
A love that should have lasted years 

  <u>C</u>               <u>Em/B</u> 
You want her, you need her 
 <u>Am</u>            <u>C/G</u>              <u>Fmaj7</u>               <u>Bb</u> 
And yet you don't believe her when she said her love is dead 
               <u>C</u>

**Chorus 

  <u>C</u>               <u>Em/B</u> 
You stay home, she goes out 
 <u>Am</u>            <u>C/G</u>              <u>Fmaj7</u>               <u>Bb</u> 
She says that long ago she knew someone but now he's gone 
               <u>C</u> 
She doesn't need him 

  <u>C</u>               <u>Em/B</u> 
Your day breaks, your mind aches 
 <u>Am</u>            <u>C/G</u>                   <u>Fmaj7</u>                   <u>Bb</u> 
There will be time when all the things she said will fill your head 
               <u>C</u>

**Chorus

title: Fixing a Hole
raw_tab:
<u>F</u>    <u>C</u>    <u>Fm7</u>   (2 beats per chord)

<u>Bb9</u>           <u>F</u>            <u>C</u>                <u>Fm7</u>        <u>Fm6</u>
          I'm fixing a hole    where the rain   gets in     and
<u>Fm7</u>                   <u>Fm6</u>                       <u>Fm7</u>       <u>Fm6</u>   <u>Fm7</u>   <u>Fm6</u>
stops my mind from wan - dering   where it will    go______


   I'm filling the cracks   that ran   through the door   and
kept my mind from wan - dering where it will go     And it

<u>F</u>                 <u>Gm/C</u>            <u>F</u>          <u>Gm/C</u>
really doesn't matter if I'm wrong I'm right  where I belong
<u>F</u>          <u>Gm/C</u>            <u>F</u>
I'm right   where I belong

<u>C</u>                   <u>G</u>             <u>C</u>            <u>G</u>
See the people standing there who disagree and never win and
<u>C</u>               <u>G</u>               <u>C</u>
wonder why they don't get in my door      I'm

<u>F</u>                 <u>C</u>          <u>Fm7</u>        <u>Fm6</u>   <u>Fm7</u>
painting the room   in a col - orful way   and when my mind is wan -
<u>Fm6</u>                  <u>Fm7</u>       <u>Fm6</u>    <u>Fm7</u>
dering   there I will go              Oo oo oo ah


Silly people run around who worry me and never ask me
why they don't get past my door      I'm
taking the time to do a number of things that weren't important yes-
terday  and I still go



 "Fixing a Hole"
Written by Paul McCartney
Performed by the Beatles
from "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band"



_______________________________________________________
Contribuição: Rui Gustavo Borba(ruigustavo@hotmail.com)

title: Every Little Thing
raw_tab: Every Little Thing (Beatles) Intro: A D E |----------------------------| |-5--5--5---5-----10---12----| |-6--7--6---4-----11---13----| |-7--7--7---7-----12---14----| |----------------------------| |----------------------------| A D E 1. When I'm walking beside her, A G-D People tell me I'm lucky. Bm Bm/A E A Yes I know I'm a lucky guy. A D E I remember the first time, A G-D I was lonely without her. Bm Bm/A E A Yes I'm thinking about her now. Chorus Chorus fill A G Every little thing she does, |------------------| G/A-A G/A-A |-5\3----3/5-------| She does for me, yeah. |-6\4----4/6-------| A G |-7\5----5/7-------| And you know the things she does, |------------------| G/A-A G/A-A |------------------| She does for me, ooh. A D E 2. When I'm with her I'm happy, A G D Just to know that she loves me. Bm Bm/A E A Yes I know that she loves me now. A D E There is one thing I'm sure of. A G-D I will love her forever. Bm Bm/A E A For I know love will never die. Chorus Instrumental: A D E A G D Bm Bm/A E A Chorus (intro) A D E Every little thing. A D E Every little thing.

title: Birthday
raw_tab:
Enjoy.
BASSTAB FOR:
The 
""
From the album "THE BEATLES"
Transcribed by: Brian Blackwell  
Email at:  BACWELL2@AOL.COM


g---------------------------|
d---------5-4-------------4-|
a-----4-7-----7---4-4-7-7---|
e-5-5-----------5-----------| 


g---------5-4-------------4-|
d-----4-7-----7---4-4-7-7---|      You'll notice the five extra beats at
a-5-5-----------5-----------|      the end of the main riff. These are fills
e---------------------------|      and are present in the recording if you 
                                   listen closely. Unlike the guitar the
g---------7-6-------------6-|      Bass line never rests.
d-----6-9-----9---6-6-9-9---|
a-7-7-----------7-----------|
e---------------------------|


after ringo's little drum fill come in with an E note.  I like to use the second fret of the D string.  Just listen to the song to get the rythm.


then comes the chorus fill..
g---------------------------------|
d-----2-2-3-3-4-4-5-5-4-4-3-3-2-2-|
a-3-3-----------------------------| repeat several times.
e---------------------------------|


then these little riffs come in.
g-2---0-2-0-----------|
d---2-------2-0-------|
a---------------3-0---|
e-------------------3-|


g-------2-5-9-5-7-5-2-0-|
d-----2-----------------|
a---5-------------------|
e-5---------------------|



Enjoy! And if you notice anything missing or find a mistake be sure to email me!

title: All Shook Up
raw_tab:
Written by Otis Blackwell. This is The Beatles version. 


  <u>G</u> 
1. A well a bless my soul 

What's wrong with me? 

I'm itching like a man 

On a fuzzy tree. 

My friends say I'm actin' 

As queer as a bug 

I'm in love! 

I'm All Shook Up. 
          <u>C</u>         <u>D</u>          <u>C</u> 
Uh uh huh.   Mmm  Yeah, Yeah. 

2. My hands are shaky 
And my knees are weak 
I can't seem to stand 
On my own two feet 
Who do you thank 
When you have such luck? 
I'm in love! I'm All Shook Up. 
Uh uh huh. MM Yeah, yeah. 

   <u>C</u>                                          <u>G</u> 
Please don't ask what's on my mind 
   <u>C</u>                                          <u>G</u> 
I'm a little mixed up, but I'm feelin' fine 
   <u>C</u>                                          <u>G</u> 
When I'm near that girl that I love the best 
   <u>C</u>                              <u>D</u> 
My heart beats so it scares me to death 

3. She touched my hand 
What a chill I got 
Her kisses are like 
A volcano that's hot 
I'm proud to say 
That she's my buttercup 
I'm in love! I'm All Shook Up. 
Uh uh huh. Mmm  Yeah, yeah. 

My tongue gets tied when I try to speak 
My insides shake like a leaf on a tree 
There's only one cure for this soul of mine 
That's to have the girl that I love so fine 

(repeat 3rd verse) 

(I have submitted a rather simplified, everyman version of this classic 
Elvis, because I thought the collection needed a version. All 
corrections and suggestions welcomed at Dgtalji@hotmail.com or at the 
address below) 


Enjoy!

Bm F#m Bm F#m Bm F

title: A Hard Day's Night
raw_tab:
John Lennon/ Paul McCartney Intro: G4(7) G C G F G It's been a hard day's night, and I've been working like a dog, C G F G It's been a hard day's night, I should be sleeping like a log, C D But when I get home to you, I find the things that you do, G C G Will make me feel alright. G C G F G You know I work all day, to get you money to buy you things, C G F G And it's worth it just to hear you say, you're gonna give me everything. C D7 So why on earth should I moan, 'cause when I get you alone, G C G You know I'll feel okay. Bm Em Bm When I'm home, everything seems to be right; G Em C D7 When I'm home, feeling you holding me tight, tight, yeah. title: A Day in the Life
raw_tab: Intro: G Bm Em Em7 C C G Bm Em Em7 I read the news today oh boy C C/B Asus2 About a lucky man who made the grade G Bm Em Em7 And though the news was rather sad C F Em Em7 Well I just had to laugh C F Em C I saw the photograph G Bm Em Em7 He blew his mind out in a car C C/B Asus2 He didn't notice that the lights had changed G Bm Em Em7 A crowd of people stood and stared C F They'd seen his face before Em Nobody was really sure Em7 C If he was from the House of Lords G Bm Em Em7 I saw a film today oh boy C C/B Asus2 The English Army had just won the war G Bm Em Em7 A crowd of people turned away C F Em But I just had to look Em7 C Having read the book C B5 I'd love to turn you on Instrumental:E E Dsus2 Woke up, fell out of bed, dragged a comb across my head E B7sus4 Found my way downstairs and drank a cup E B7sus4 B7 And looking up, I noticed I was late. Ha, ha, ha. E Found my coat and grabbed my hat Dsus2 Made the bus in seconds flat E B7sus4 Found my way upstairs and had a smoke E B7sus4 And somebody spoke and I went into a dream C G D A E C G D A E D C D Ah... Ah... Ah... Ah... Ah... G Bm Em Em7 I read the news today oh boy C C/B Asus2 Four thousand holes in Blackburn, Lancashire. G Bm Em Em7 And though the holes were rather small C F They had to count them all; Em Em7 C Now they know how many holes it takes to fill the Albert Hall. B5 I'd love to turnn you on. Instrumental: E
